title: Cat. 111  Three People, a Mask, a Fox and a Bird, 1899
publication_title: Gauguin Paintings, Sculpture, and Graphic Works at the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Three People, a Mask, a Fox and a Bird, headpiece for Le sourire (The Smile)  
1899  
Only state  
Wood-block print in black ink on thin ivory laid Japanese paper; 100 × 186 mm (image); 127 × 228 mm (sheet)  
Signed recto, lower left, in brush and black ink: PG.  
Inscribed recto, lower right, in brush and black ink: No. 10  
The Art Institute of Chicago, gift of Edward McCormick Blair, 2002.243  
Guérin 75, Kornfeld 58 B

Three People, a Mask, a Fox, and a Bird, headpiece for Le sourire (The Smile)  
1899  
Only state  
Wood-block print in black ink on thin ivory laid Japanese paper; 90 × 185 mm (image); 94 × 186 mm (sheet)  
Signed recto, lower left, in brush and black ink: PG. 18  
The Art Institute of Chicago, gift of Frank B. Hubachek, 1946.33  
Guérin 75, Kornfeld 58 B

Printed by Pola Gauguin (1883–1961)  
Published by Christian Cato, Copenhagen  
Three People, a Mask, a Fox and a Bird, headpiece for Le sourire (The Smile)  
1899, printed and published 1921  
Only state  
Wood-block print in black ink on ivory China paper; 103 × 184 mm (image); 268 × 425 mm (sheet)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, the Joseph Brooks Fair Collection, 1924.1194  
Guérin 75, Kornfeld 58 D,b

</section><section id="figures">Top left, Three People, a Mask, a Fox and a Bird, headpiece for Le sourire (The Smile), 1899 (cat. 111.1).
